Header: U.S. lobsters to “pinch” customers’ pockets after additional Chinese tariffs
Content: American lobsters have long had a reputation in China for its high quality meat, but this key menu item is now facing an additional 25 percent import duty expected to come into effect. China will impose extra 25 percent tariffs on 659 U.S. goods, ranging from soybeans and autos to seafood, worth $34 billion in response to the U.S. announcement that it will levy tariffs on Chinese imports, from today. China imported about $128 million worth of live lobsters from the United States in 2017, accounting for 15 to 20 percent of the total U.S. lobster exports.
